timeline.message:
merging inconsistent tie-line element names

Signed-off-by: benrejebmoh <mohamed.ben-rejeb@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: Replace String.format by a simple concatenation (performance issue)
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText:
I'm not sure we should make a specific case for element names. Maybe we should decide the strategy, and apply it to all properties.
@murgeyseb What do you think?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Yes, I think we could keep the same behaviour for Element name, and change the parsing of the property in the exporter to create a unique element name if needed, using the same strategy as before (if equals use it, if one empty use the other, otherwise no element name)
replies.author: murgeyseb

replies.bodyText: But if we don't make a specific case for element names this strategy of concatenating the two  side's property will impcact all types of property. for example the geographical name it will create other problems. Should i delete this condition here ? but make another one in exporter saying if geographival name contains the separator "," --> don't export it
replies.author: benrejebmoh

timeline.bodyText: The property separator should be a constant, just in case this is not well chosen and we have to change it.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.message:
using properties separator as constant and changing String.format by simple concatenation

Signed-off-by: benrejebmoh <mohamed.ben-rejeb@rte-france.com>

removing null default value when getting geographical name property

Signed-off-by: benrejebmoh <mohamed.ben-rejeb@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: Could you please complete the description of the PR and adapt the unit-test, to be sure this fix works properly. In the description, you mention you want to change the elementName of the tieLines, but you never mention the geographical name of the XNode.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: This is not necessary: empty is a good enough to be serialized.
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.message:
adding tieline properties with suffix to be usied in ucte export, and adding test case illustration possible use cases
